page.title: 07A DECADE OF EDUCATION
page.content: {NOW:}7200 pupils aged 5-18 are accommodated in 28 schools,all except 3 being co-educational.Of these schools 3 charge fees,5 are church establishments and 20 are County controlled.These 28 schools include 10 First(5-8),2 First/Middle(5-12),9 Middle(8-12),4 Secondary Comprehensive(12-16)(though some of these are annexes of out of area schools),1 Grammar(12-18),1 Sixth Form College(16-18) and 1 Special School. Private play and nursery groups cater for the "under 5's". {CHANGE OVER THE PAST TEN YEARS:} Numbers on roll have decreased by 20%. Two Secondary Schools have closed and one renamed and redesignated a Community School.One Primary School has been closed and converted into a Teachers' Centre.Three Primary Schools have been rebuilt.
